doc.field: Series XXIII: Pride and Progress / The Right Stuff
Series XXIII: Pride and Progress / The Right Stuff
[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 24 [2]--The Right Stuff [Air Date: 6/9/1986]
[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 24 [2]--The Right Stuff [Air Date: 6/9/1986]

Pride and ProgressNews-highlights:1. Washington, DC, City Council passes bill prohibiting insurance companies from denying coverage to "high risk" persons or those with HTLVIII antibody2. Providence, Rhode Island, equal rights amendment killed by constitutional conventional committeeCOMMERCIAL: First Hand gay magazine3. Senatorial candidate Phil Reed discusses a state gay rights billCOMMERCIAL: Urban General Warehouse Sale4. Event announcement5. Andy Humm discusses relationships breaking up6. Anchorage, Alaska, Mayor opposes amendment of equal rights ordinance to include homosexualsCOMMERCIAL: "New York Native" with Quentin Crisp7. Colorado, senate and house committees fail to vote on AIDS quarantine bill8. US Senate raises AIDS research budget9. AIDS becomes leading killer of men aged 30-44 and women aged 25-29 in New York City10. Soldier is court-martialed after refusing to take a required HTLVIII antibody test11. Two female high-schoolers allowed to attend prom together after a court orderCOMMERCIAL: Arcos Blancos resort, Puerto Rico12. Sports ReportCOMMERCIAL: New York City Gay Men's Chorus13. Outreach: Conversations with GMHC: Interview with Raymond Jacobs, discussing GMHC's erotic safer-sex movie "Chance of a Lifetime" and safer-sex workshops14. Closing Credits
The Right Stuff:1. This Week in Gay History with Jeff BixbyCOMMERCIAL: SF AIDS FoundationInterview with Kevin Glines, playwright and co-founder of non-profit gay arts organization The GlinesCOMMERCIAL: Body-mate exercise equipmentInterview with Stephen Holt, playwright, discusses his play "The Casting of Kevin Christian," reading from playCOMMERCIAL: Water Front Airways
[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 24 [2]--The Right Stuff [Air Date: 6/9/1986]: June 1986
